title: Environments descriptions
description_array: We describe in 'private/config/server/environments.json' configuration file the per-environment configuration of the application.
By convention, this 'environments' object should be included inside of a 'MyApplication' object.

^.*$.description: The name of the application as the key of the 'environments' object.

environments.description: The configuration of each environment as an object where keys are the environment identifier.

^.*$.description: The identifier of the environment, to be addressed by the 'APP_ENV' environment variable on the server.

type.description: The type of the environment as known by NodeJS.

packages.description: the description of which and how packages are to be re-configured for this environment.

^.*$.description: The name of the package to be reconfigured.

global.description: The name of the exported object of the package which contains the 'configure()' function.

conf.description: An object which contains the configuration to be passed to the 'configure()' function.

description_array: While other properties are available to the client via the 'environmentSettings()' function, those described in this object are kept on the server only.
They so can include passwords and other sensible data though the maintainer could rather consider the 'maintainer/private/deployments.json' configuration file as addressed by 'meteor.pl deploy' verb.

title.description: The application title displayed in the header of the application pages.
